segment.source: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 1.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: This topic describes the steps that you should take to move one or more Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features to a different computer.
segment.target: This topic describes the steps that you should take to move one or more Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features to a different computer.

segment.source: When you move more than one MBAM feature to another computer, you should move them in the following order:
segment.target: When you move more than one MBAM feature to another computer, you should move them in the following order:

segment.source: Recovery and Hardware Database
segment.target: Recovery and Hardware Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring

segment.source: To move the Recovery and Hardware Database
segment.target: To move the Recovery and Hardware Database

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to move the MBAM Recovery and Hardware Database from one computer to another (you can move this MBAM Server feature from Server A to Server B):
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to move the MBAM Recovery and Hardware Database from one computer to another (you can move this MBAM Server feature from Server A to Server B):

segment.source: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring web site.
segment.target: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring web site.

segment.source: Run the MBAM Setup on Server B.
segment.target: Run the MBAM Setup on Server B.

segment.source: Back up the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server A.
segment.target: Back up the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server A.

segment.source: MBAM Recovery and Hardware database from Server A to B
segment.target: MBAM Recovery and Hardware database from Server A to B

segment.source: Restore the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server B
segment.target: Restore the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server B

segment.source: Configure the access to the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server B
segment.target: Configure the access to the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database on Server B

segment.source: Update the database connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers
segment.target: Update the database connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers

segment.source: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring web site
segment.target: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring web site

segment.source: To stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: To stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: Use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website on each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature.
segment.target: Use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website on each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature.

segment.source: The MBAM website is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: The MBAM website is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command at the command prompt that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command at the command prompt that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run this PowerShell command prompt, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to the current instance of PowerShell.
segment.target: To run this PowerShell command prompt, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to the current instance of PowerShell.

segment.source: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable the execution of scripts.
segment.target: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable the execution of scripts.

segment.source: To run MBAM setup on Server B
segment.target: To run MBAM setup on Server B

segment.source: Run the MBAM setup on Server B and select the Recovery and Hardware Database for installation.
segment.target: Run the MBAM setup on Server B and select the Recovery and Hardware Database for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command at the command prompt that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command at the command prompt that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the server and instance to which the Recovery and Hardware database will be moved.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the server and instance to which the Recovery and Hardware database will be moved.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Application and Monitoring Server that will contact the Recovery and Hardware database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Application and Monitoring Server that will contact the Recovery and Hardware database.

segment.source: If there are multiple domain and server names, use a semicolon to separate each one of them in the list.
segment.target: If there are multiple domain and server names, use a semicolon to separate each one of them in the list.

segment.source: For example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$.
segment.target: For example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$.

segment.source: Additionally, each server name must be followed by a .
segment.target: Additionally, each server name must be followed by a .

segment.source: For example, MyDomainMyServerName1$, MyDomainMyServerName2$.
segment.target: For example, MyDomainMyServerName1$, MyDomainMyServerName2$.

segment.source: To back up the Database on Server A
segment.target: To back up the Database on Server A

segment.source: To back up the Recovery and Hardware database on Server A, use SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Back Up….
segment.target: To back up the Recovery and Hardware database on Server A, use SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Back Up….

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery and Hardware Database.

segment.source: To move the Database and Certificate from Server A to B
segment.target: To move the Database and Certificate from Server A to B

segment.source: Move the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database data.bak from Server A to Server B by using Windows Explorer.
segment.target: Move the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database data.bak from Server A to Server B by using Windows Explorer.

segment.target: To move the certificate for the encrypted database, you will need to use the following automation steps.

segment.source: To restore the Database on Server B
segment.target: To restore the Database on Server B

segment.source: Restore the Recovery and Hardware database on Server B by using the SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Restore Database.
segment.target: Restore the Recovery and Hardware database on Server B by using the SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Restore Database.

segment.source: Once the task has been executed, choose the database backup file by selecting the From Device option, and then use the Add command to choose the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database Data.bak file.
segment.target: Once the task has been executed, choose the database backup file by selecting the From Device option, and then use the Add command to choose the MBAM Recovery and Hardware database Data.bak file.

segment.source: Select OK to complete the restoration process.
segment.target: Select OK to complete the restoration process.

segment.source: Configure the access to the Database on Server B
segment.target: Configure the access to the Database on Server B

segment.source: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager, to add the computer accounts from each server that runs the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Group named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.
segment.target: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager, to add the computer accounts from each server that runs the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Group named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.

segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain name and machine name of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: The server name must be followed by a , for example, MyDomainMyServerName1$.

segment.source: To update the Database Connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers
segment.target: To update the Database Connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers

segment.source: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Connection String information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website:
segment.target: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Connection String information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website:

segment.source: MBAM Administration Service
segment.target: MBAM Administration Service

segment.source: MBAM Recovery And Hardware Service
segment.target: MBAM Recovery And Hardware Service

segment.source: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.
segment.target: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.

segment.source: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.
segment.target: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.

segment.source: Choose the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.
segment.target: Choose the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, choose the row named KeyRecoveryConnectionString when you updated the configuration for the ‘MBAMAdministrationService’ application, or choose the row named Microsoft.Mbam.RecoveryAndHardwareDataStore.ConnectionString, when updating the configuration for the ‘MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService’.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, choose the row named KeyRecoveryConnectionString when you updated the configuration for the ‘MBAMAdministrationService’ application, or choose the row named Microsoft.Mbam.RecoveryAndHardwareDataStore.ConnectionString, when updating the configuration for the ‘MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService’.

segment.source: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the server name and the instance where the Recovery and Hardware Database was moved to.
segment.target: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the server name and the instance where the Recovery and Hardware Database was moved to.

segment.source: For example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$.
segment.target: For example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$.

segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row named ComplianceStatusConnectionString, when you update the configuration for the MBAMAdministrationService application, or the row named Microsoft.Windows.Mdop.BitLockerManagement.StatusReportDataStore.ConnectionString, when you update the configuration for the MBAMComplianceStatusService.

segment.source: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the server name and the instance name.

segment.source: To resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: To resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM web site named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM web site named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To moving the Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: To moving the Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: If you choose to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Reports from one computer to another (specifically, if you move feature from Server A to Server B), you should use the following procedure and steps:
segment.target: If you choose to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Reports from one computer to another (specifically, if you move feature from Server A to Server B), you should use the following procedure and steps:

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B

segment.source: Configure Access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B
segment.target: Configure Access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B

segment.source: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: Update the reports connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers
segment.target: Update the reports connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers

segment.source: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: To run MBAM setup on Server B
segment.target: To run MBAM setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B and only select the Compliance and Audit feature for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B and only select the Compliance and Audit feature for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the values from the preceding example with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the values from the preceding example with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance Status Database is located.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance Status Database is located.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain name and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit reports feature to connect to the Compliance Status Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain name and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit reports feature to connect to the Compliance Status Database.

segment.source: $PASSWORD$ - Enter the password of the user account that will be used to connect to the Compliance Status Database.
segment.target: $PASSWORD$ - Enter the password of the user account that will be used to connect to the Compliance Status Database.

segment.source: To configure the access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B
segment.target: To configure the access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B

segment.source: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the user accounts that will have access to the Compliance and Audit Reports.
segment.target: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the user accounts that will have access to the Compliance and Audit Reports.

segment.source: Add the user accounts to the local group named “MBAM Report Users”.
segment.target: Add the user accounts to the local group named “MBAM Report Users”.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell on Server B.
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following, by using Windows PowerShell on Server B.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following value from the preceding example with the applicable values for your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following value from the preceding example with the applicable values for your environment:

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports

segment.source: The command to add the users to the MBAM Report Users local group must be run for each user that will be accessing the reports in your environment.
segment.target: The command to add the users to the MBAM Report Users local group must be run for each user that will be accessing the reports in your environment.

segment.source: To stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: To stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Feature use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Feature use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: To update the Database Connection Data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers
segment.target: To update the Database Connection Data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers

segment.source: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Compliance Reports URL.
segment.target: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Compliance Reports URL.

segment.source: Select the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website and use the Configuration Editor feature which can be found under the Management section of the Feature View.
segment.target: Select the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website and use the Configuration Editor feature which can be found under the Management section of the Feature View.

segment.source: Select the appSettings option from the Section list control.
segment.target: Select the appSettings option from the Section list control.

segment.source: From here, select the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.
segment.target: From here, select the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, select the row named “Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url”.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row named “Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url”.

segment.source: Update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B. If the Compliance and Audit reports feature was installed on a named SQL Reporting Services instance, make sure that you add or update the name of the instance to the URL.
segment.target: Update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B. If the Compliance and Audit reports feature was installed on a named SQL Reporting Services instance, make sure that you add or update the name of the instance to the URL.

segment.source: For example, http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLSRSINSTANCENAME$/Pages....
segment.target: For example, http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLSRSINSTANCENAME$/Pages....

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command that is similar to the following one on each Administration and Monitoring Server:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command that is similar to the following one on each Administration and Monitoring Server:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the value from the preceding example with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the value from the preceding example with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.

segment.source: $SRSINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the SQL Reporting Services instance to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.
segment.target: $SRSINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the SQL Reporting Services instance to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.

segment.source: To resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website
segment.target: To resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website

segment.source: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Start the MBAM web site named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each of the servers that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Start the MBAM web site named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To execute this command, the IIS Module for PowerShell must be added to the current instance of PowerShell.
segment.target: To execute this command, the IIS Module for PowerShell must be added to the current instance of PowerShell.

segment.source: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable execution of scripts.
segment.target: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable execution of scripts.

segment.source: To move the Administration and Monitoring feature
segment.target: To move the Administration and Monitoring feature

segment.source: If you choose to move the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Reports feature from one computer to another, (if you move feature from Server A to Server B), you should use the following procedure.
segment.target: If you choose to move the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Reports feature from one computer to another, (if you move feature from Server A to Server B), you should use the following procedure.

segment.source: The process includes the following steps:
segment.target: The process includes the following steps:

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B

segment.source: Configure Access to the Database on Server B
segment.target: Configure Access to the Database on Server B

segment.source: To run MBAM setup on Server B
segment.target: To run MBAM setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B and only select the Administration feature for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B and only select the Administration feature for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the values from the preceding example with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the values from the preceding example with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - For the COMPLIDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, input the server name and instance where the Compliance Status Database is located.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - For the COMPLIDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, input the server name and instance where the Compliance Status Database is located.

segment.source: For the RECOVERYANDHWDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, input the server name and instance where the Recovery and Hardware Database is located.
segment.target: For the RECOVERYANDHWDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, input the server name and instance where the Recovery and Hardware Database is located.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit reports feature to connect to the Compliance Status Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit reports feature to connect to the Compliance Status Database.

segment.source: $ REPORTSSERVERURL$ - Enter the URL for the Home location of the SQL Reporting Service website.
segment.target: $ REPORTSSERVERURL$ - Enter the URL for the Home location of the SQL Reporting Service website.

segment.source: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance the URL format will formatted “http:// $SERVERNAME$/ReportServer”.
segment.target: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance the URL format will formatted “http:// $SERVERNAME$/ReportServer”.

segment.source: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will be formatted to “http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLINSTANCENAME$”.
segment.target: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will be formatted to “http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLINSTANCENAME$”.

segment.source: To configure the Access to the Databases
segment.target: To configure the Access to the Databases

segment.source: On server or servers where the Recovery and Hardware, and Compliance and Audit databases are deployed, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the machine accounts from each server that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Groups named “MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access” (Recovery and Hardware DB Server) and “MBAM Compliance Status DB Access” (Compliance and Audit DB Server).
segment.target: On server or servers where the Recovery and Hardware, and Compliance and Audit databases are deployed, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the machine accounts from each server that run the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Groups named “MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access” (Recovery and Hardware DB Server) and “MBAM Compliance Status DB Access” (Compliance and Audit DB Server).

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell on the server where the Compliance and Audit databases were deployed.
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell on the server where the Compliance and Audit databases were deployed.

segment.source: On the server where the Recovery and Hardware databases were deployed, run a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: On the server where the Recovery and Hardware databases were deployed, run a command that is similar to the following one, by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the value from the preceding example with the applicable values for your environment:
segment.target: Replace the value from the preceding example with the applicable values for your environment:

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: The server name must be followed by a .
segment.target: The server name must be followed by a .

segment.source: For example, MyDomainMyServerName1$)
segment.target: For example, MyDomainMyServerName1$)

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports.

segment.source: The commands listed for adding the server computer accounts to the MBAM local groups must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the databases in your environment.
segment.target: The commands listed for adding the server computer accounts to the MBAM local groups must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the databases in your environment.
